pam withnall wrote:
> Hi, I've got two tests in one class and want to get a value from one
> test to the other.
> I've tried varous things, used this.variable, and including accessing
> another class, but cannot get one test to set a variable and the other
> to get it.

The only way to do this is through global data. The simplest solution 
would be to use a class-level variable on your TestCase class.

Please note two things, though:

1. By default, you don't have control over the order in which tests are 
executed, so it could be that the "reading" test is executing before the 
"writing" test. If you want this control, I recommend using GSBase's 
OrderedTestSuite to control the order of some of your tests.

2. The desire to share data between tests (meaning that one test writes 
to a variable and another test reads it) goes against the basic 
philosophy of JUnit and the xUnit frameworks. They were designed so that 
tests would be /isolated/ from one another, because there are all kinds 
of benefits from keeping tests isolated. To learn more about this, look 
at the books _JUnit Recipes_ and _Test-Driven Development: By Example_, 
among others.
